item.title: Mattress and other fly-tipping all across the Charlton Church Lane pavement, 29th January
item.description:
These illegal HMOs are always fly-tipping and leaving rubbish outside around numbers 52-60 Charlton Chuch Lane. Tonight, there was a mattress covering the whole pavement. It is disgusting. Need to clear but to have temporary CCTV surveillance as it is a permanent issue.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Charlton Church Lane, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping on Bridport Place street, 29th January
item.description:
Mattress and couch fly tipped on street on Bridport Place. Has been here for several months now. Also being damaged by passersby including taking the leather off the couch.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bridport Place, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large crater in park, 29th January
item.description:
There was an explosion in the park at 22:45 on January 18th which left a large crater (about 3-4m in diameter) in the park - the grass has been destroyed and the soil around it is rippled.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lancaster Street, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights not working, utter darkness, 29th January
item.description:
The lights on the western side of Burgess Park havenâ€™t been working since early January. This includes the pedestrian bit between Addington Square and New Church Road, next to the playground. In the evening, there is total darkness. This is posing serious risks given that the path is shared with cyclists and because of ongoing crime in and around the park.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Addington Square, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Increased litter levels, 29th January
item.description:
This evening on my walk back to my property from Shortlands Station, up Station Road, there was a significant amount of litter dotted about, by bushes on street corners, on the road consisting of cans, tissues stuck to the ground, cigarette packets and part of a car tyre. I've never seen it like this before - can this please be cleaned up?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queen's Mead Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole in middle of road, 29th January
item.description:

item.title: Road crumbling, 29th January
item.description:
The main road is crumbling from heavy vehicles and buses speeding down the road. Debris from the road is all over the path. Houses on Crown Dale shake from the vehicles hitting potholes and cracks in the road. It starts at the junction and continues down to just before Norwood School. Shocking this road is allowed to deteriorate in this way as it is such a busy road with houses, flats and three schools.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crown Dale, Upper Norwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
